Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk device-mapper-multipath
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: device-mapper-multipath bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description: The device-mapper-multipath packages provide tools that use the device-mapper multipath kernel module to manage multipath devices. This update fixes the following bug: Previously, the multipath utility checked the "tgtname" sysfs file when determining whether a device was an iSCSI device. However, the file name has changed to "targetname", which led to incorrect identification by multipath, as it failed to identify iSCSI devices and did not use the iSCSI specific configuration functions. As a consequence, multipath was incorrectly setting the "fast_io_fail_tmo" option for iSCSI devices. With this update, multipath checks both for "tgtname" and "targetname", and thus correctly identifies iSCSI devices and configures them as expected. (BZ#1267131) Users of device-mapper-multipath are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix this bug. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
